attributes.action: Ban the sale of filtered cigarettes across the UK.
attributes.background: It is widely accepted that cigarette filters have little to no health benefits for smokers. Many understand that cigarette filters contain large amounts of toxic chemicals but most people do not realise they contain plastic and are the biggest ocean pollutant on the planet.
attributes.additional_details:
Over 4.5 trillion cigarette butts find their way into the environment every single year. It's estimated that a cigarette butt will take 10-12 years to break down.

By banning cigarette filters we could eliminate a massive percentage of plastic/litter finding its way to our streets, rivers and oceans almost overnight benefiting us, wildlife and the environment. It's likely to encourage more smokers to give up too.

attributes.action: Stop convicted criminals being able to change name by Deed poll.
attributes.background: This is very important. Just recently a child killer who served only 3 yrs changed his name by deed poll to hide his criminal past. No background checks are made when applying to change name by deed poll, why?
attributes.additional_details: Background checks on passports, entering Government buildings and new jobs, but we have no background checks on people wanting to change name legally, it can be done within and hour online.

attributes.action: Amnesty for T4 students who overstayed because of colleges closed by UK in 2014.
attributes.background: In 2014 to achieve the unrealistic target of net migration figure, the UKBA closed a large number of colleges and played with students’ future. They lost their tuition fees and many of them didn’t find a way to came out from this problem.
attributes.additional_details: Young people especially the students are the backbone of every economy in the world. Most of the overstayed students are good at English and are working part-time as well, to support themselves and the UK economy by paying taxes. They are just the victims of unrealistic Home Office targets. Many of them are now working in low paid jobs and the businesses are just abusing and exploiting them. Giving them amnesty will bring them into the taxpayer net, and yield millions of pounds in tax and national insurance and they will contribute to the UK economy.

attributes.action: Give local authorities a legal duty of care towards those waiting for housing
attributes.background: My son Lee had leukaemia, while in remission he was waiting to be housed by our council who failed to house him in time. Lee then passed away at my home from catching influenza when he should have been isolated from the public. I was suing my council but lost as we could not have our case heard.
attributes.additional_details: My solicitor and barrister thought I had a good chance of succeeding if all my evidence was heard first which then we could have proved a case of negligence.  However, the court decided that the council had no duty of care so they wouldn’t listen to all the evidence. Please sign this petition for future cases. If councils had a legal duty of care towards those on their housing waiting lists ALL of the evidence in this and similar cases would be heard and not decided before! Please see Ref: Court of Appeal court 75 applicants no B3/2015/1289 dated 11th April 2017 Lilian Darby versus London borough of Richmond upon Thames

attributes.action: Remove legal privilege from the PHSO so police can investigate misconduct
attributes.background: The Parliamentary and Health Service Ombudsman has legal privilege which means that the police cannot look at their case files to investigate allegations of staff misconduct in public office. The PHSO investigates the death of our loved ones but the police have never been able to intervene.
attributes.additional_details: The PSHO should not appear to be above the law. During the investigation into the death of my son, I believe that staff didn’t do their jobs correctly which led to a flawed report and decision. I’ll never be able to know for sure however because the police are not able to investigate. This means I will  never know the truth behind my son’s death. This is unacceptable.

attributes.action: Ensure British food standards are met in any free trade agreement with USA
attributes.background: Once 'Brexit' is complete the government will be able to seek its own Free Trade Agreements (FTAs) with other countries, most notably the USA. The USA use hormones in the rearing of their meat, Genetically Modified vegetables, and have low animal welfare requirements.
attributes.additional_details: We want all food in Britain to adhere to our standards. We do not want chicken that has been washed in chlorine, we do not want beef which has been injected with hormones, we do not want pigs who have suffered horrendous conditions to be allowed to arrive in the UK. Raising and management of animal products in this way goes against the values that the British public hold. We hold our government accountable for protecting these values.

attributes.action: Fund a 24-hour suicide text line
attributes.background: Many people suffer from severe anxiety and may not feel comfortable making phone calls to crisis teams or suicide helplines so they avoid calling which could put them in danger. Text lines could be quicker, easier and more comfortable for younger people as well as people with severe anxiety.
attributes.additional_details: ‘The share of device owners saying they make at least one voice call a week has dropped down from 96% to 75% over the past three years, according to research carried out by Ipsos Mori for Deloitte.’ Taken from The Guardian. This shows people are using phone calls less and less so making 24 hour text lines may make more people reach it for help when they need it. Texting is quicker but it can also help people feel more comfortable with opening up so they could be more honest to get the help needed.

attributes.action: Raise the max speed limit on motorways to 110 mph.
attributes.background: Due to the increasing tech of today's cars it becoming more and more unsafe to have an enforced 70 mph speed limit on UK motorways.
attributes.additional_details:
70 mph speed limits were introduced in 1965 when car wheels looked more like today's bicycle wheels. Technology has moved on unbelievable amounts in the subsequent over half a century, and is tried tested and proven to be safe at speeds exceeding 70 mph.
The mixture of the 70 mph speed limit and today's tech and ease of speed in cars erodes away at our famous British ability to maintain safe lane discipline on our motorways.

attributes.action: Demand a pay cut of £13,612 of all MLAs in Northern Ireland
attributes.background: There has been deadlock in Stormont with key players obstructing negotiations since the assembly collapse. Public services are suffering due to the collapse while public servants receive full pay. This is unreasonable!
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/www.bbc.co.uk/news/amp/uk-northern-ireland-42418944
I z http://www.itv.com/news/utv/2018-03-13/bradley-rejects-claims-of-dithering-over-mla-pay/

attributes.action: First Aid education should be mandatory in all schools.
attributes.background: Too many people die and suffer unnecessarily because the majority of the population-myself included- don't know basic first aid.
attributes.additional_details: I've never been in a situation where my actions could result in the difference between someone living or dying-thankfully- , and although I should have already undertaken a first aid course, to my shame I haven't.  However,  if it was something ingrained into you from an early age, there wouldn't be the need to pay to undertake such a course?..

attributes.action: Return the Road Fund Licence, back to weight of vehicle and NOT emissions.
attributes.background: Vehicle Road Fund licence was changed to a Green Tax with no public consultation.
attributes.additional_details: The Road Fund Licence or Car Tax as it is known was based on vehicle weight NOT emissions. It needs to be returned to this. The Government encouraged people to buy diesel cars, now they want them scrapped. That is not fair when diesels are more cost efficient. What puts more pollutants directly into the air? Air travel only been around for about 100 years but has done some damage.

attributes.action: Legalise cannabis for medicinal purposes
attributes.background:
Evidence has shown that the use of CBD products improve help in cancer patients, people who suffer from severe epilepsy’s, MS and Parkinson’s desease
It’s time for action

attributes.action: Get schools to teach life skills and how to handle emotions
attributes.background: Schools need to teach children more about how to handle their emotions. Talking to children about what to do with their feelings and how to express them without causing themselves harm. Also life skills, like managing money, building a career and learning how to start a life as an adult.
attributes.additional_details:
When leaving school, you have your grades, you have big plans about going to university and starting a life as an individual. But are schools teaching children what and where to go next? NO!
They don’t teach children what to do when they feel depressed, upset or handle their emotions. Self harm and suicide is on the rise! Schools can help this! 
They don’t teach children how to look into property and buying a house,  pay a bill and setting up direct debts. They NEED to teach life skills.

attributes.action: Permit marriage outdoors without the requirement of a permanent structure
attributes.background: Permit UK citizens to marry under a non-religious legally binding ceremony, in England and Wales, in all outdoor spaces without the requirement of a physical permanent structure. Laws already exist in Scotland and Northern Island. I am calling for equality within all countries of the United Kingdom.

attributes.action: require proactive cleansing of our sewers under section 94 of the water act 1991
attributes.background: Currently the countries sewers are not being inspected for 40 plus years leading to fat bergs blockages and restricted flows. Reactive cleaning after blockages is detrimental to our infrastructures ability to cope with additional housing
attributes.additional_details: Ofwat have stated it is acceptable for manholes not to be lifted for 40 plus years meaning no maintenance cleansing or attempt to keep flowing of our sewers. This leads to serious blockages and fat bergs - syphons need inspecting every two years pipework cleaning ever 8 to 10 years - this policy is detrimental to public health and is fundamentally irrational interpretation of the law, simple because no time limit to cleaning is present within the state this does not mean it removes common sense.

attributes.action: Make it law for all property floors to be soundproofed if above another property
attributes.background: Property in the UK, especially in London can be very close to one another. If you live beneath someone in a flat and they haven’t got efficient soundproofing it can be a nuisance even though the people above aren’t doing anything wrong.
attributes.additional_details: I lived in a property for three years where the noises from above became a constant nuisance. All they were doing was walking but it was an awful noise, especially at night when they would be awake at 1am. My anger was not directed at my neighbours but at the law not looking after people living beneath other people.

attributes.action: Fund a student railway discount card to lower costs
attributes.background: I am 17 years old, and I have to pay £6.70 a day to just get to school. This isn’t even including the cost of getting home. Why should I have to pay such an extortionate amount of money to go somewhere that I have to be by law?

attributes.action: Avoid no deal Brexit
attributes.background: The government has let us down with its negotiations with the EU and we are heading for a no deal scenario, which leaders in all fields say will be hugely damaging to the UK in many areas of life, from health to air travel to food imports. We must avoid a no deal situation.
attributes.additional_details: We need to accept we need more time to organise our departure from the EU and request an extension to the article 50 process. This will give the UK time to continue talks, hold an general election or seek further opinion from the public to determine how Brexit should proceed.  Most importantly we will avoid a damaging no deal scenario which will harm poor and vulnerable people the most

attributes.action: Prevent payment of EU ‘exit fee’ until a beneficial trade deal has been ratified
attributes.background:
The Government has offered to pay up to £39bn to the EU as an exit fee despite there being no legal requirement to do so.
Put it into law that not a penny should be paid until a final trade deal with demonstrable benefits to the UK economy has been signed and ratified by all EU member states.

attributes.action: Improve the transition from mental health child service to adult
attributes.background: As it stands the mental health services in the UK discharge young people at the age of 18 and in some cases even 17 and move them onto the adult services. This process is in most cases tricky and many get lost in the system. The system needs a change to help the people who need it.

attributes.action: Legislate to make all sewage treatment plants into biomass digesters.
attributes.background: IThis has a number of benefits. Capping the tanks where the solid waste is digested would mean that less smell and methane (one of the worst greenhouse gases) is released into the atmosphere.  Instead it would be fed into the gas network reducing our reliance on imported or fracked gas.
attributes.additional_details: Raw sewage is also sprayed onto fields.  It still smells and is still releasing methane.  It is easily washed out and pollutes water and it has less benefit for the soil.  Processed sewage is drier and more composted.  There is little methane and and nutrients are locked inand are not so easily washed out therefore it feeds and conditions the soil. It can also be used all year round and not just on empty fields.

attributes.action: Supermarkets to be legally obliged to sell high sugar cereals separately.
attributes.background: Some breakfast cereals increasingly resemble confectionery, with many types having versions containing chocolate. Many contain between 20-39% sugar, are packaged to appeal to children, and are advertised on children’s TV. Meanwhile, childhood obesity rates continue to climb.
attributes.additional_details:
Many children consume over half their recommended daily amount of sugar at breakfast (Public Health England 2017). 
1in 5 British children finishes primary school obese (NHS 2017).
Typical supermarket Corn Flakes contain about 10% sugar.
Typical confectionery bars contain 45-50% sugar.
The govt. should make supermarkets legally obliged to sell those breakfast cereals containing 20-40% sugar separately, in the confectionery aisle, away from other breakfast cereals.

attributes.action: Animal abuse charges to be the same as human abuse charges
attributes.background: Murder is murder, assault is assault, physical abuse is physical abuse whether it is a human or an animal anyone found murdering or assaulting an animal should be punished the same as if they had murdered/assaulted a human to the maximum extent of the law.
attributes.additional_details:
Thousands of animals are killed murdered, brutally beaten, or left to starve to death. The sentencing for these offences is often a minimum Unlimited fine and/or 6 months. Help to stop animal suffering by signing our petition. 

Examples: - 
http://www.da4a.org/sport.htm
https://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/katy-gammon-solicitor-who-locked-3391542
https://www.snopes.com/fact-check/donald-trumps-son-game-hunting-photos/

attributes.action: Each child receiving high rate DLA should have a ECHP when they turn 3
attributes.background: I thought my son would go to mainstream school, I was wrong. If the EHCP was a procedure that was required to happen, he would not be without a school. Most high rate DLA children cannot cope in a mainstream school. This needs to be in place to give parents the options that’s right for their child.
attributes.additional_details: I have waited 31 weeks and still have no place as I was not given enough guidance. This is a process most will only go through once. Let’s make it easier to get a child into the right school. Inclusion, not exclusion. No mainstream school could cater for my son. Many children are placed in the wrong provisions to make the numbers match. It’s time this changed and this process is looked at.

attributes.action: To include adult grooming in the Sexual Offences Act 2003.
attributes.background:
Age is arbitrary and anyone can be groomed. 

This could mean an elderly person, someone with a mental health condition or just someone who has their guard down. 

Let's change the legislation to help these victims and stop these heinous acts from continuing.
attributes.additional_details:
'Grooming can be defined as the process that an abuser uses to desensitise someone – to make them less like to reject or report abusive behaviour.'

https://www.survivorsuk.org/question/grooming/

Also use the site for further information.

attributes.action: Don't ban single use plastic straws for disabled people.
attributes.background: People with no arms or extremely short arms, people paralysed from the neck down, people with severe arthritis,muscle wasting diseases,cerebral palsy, these are just some disabled people who NEED straws to stay hydrated, my list by no means covers every type of impairment where straws are necessary.
attributes.additional_details: Plain and simple, if you cannot use your arms then you NEED a straw. The evidence so far regarding the alternatives to plastic straws is, the biodegradable ones start degrading when you put them in a hot drink as to the wheat ones, glass ones are dangerous for those who may accidentally bite them, bamboo and other wooden types are not flexible enough, some of the alternatives also change the flavour of the drink.

attributes.action: I want the employees' contracts with zero hours to disappear.
attributes.background:
I want the employees' contracts with zero hours to disappear.
Staff recruitment agencies and companies should be sanctioned if they do not hand over to employees the minimum work contract signed and job description.
attributes.additional_details: I want a normative act that clearly stipulates that work contracts with font size of rights and obligations, terms and conditions of minimum 10 and not written in very small letters, in order not to violate the employee's right to correct, complete and accurate information.

attributes.action: Get Deaf Road Warning signs onto our streets.
attributes.background: I am the mother of a 9 year-old profoundly Deaf boy. It struck me when visiting Europe and my family in the US that many countries and states have Deaf road warning signs in areas near schools with Deaf children and young adults, as well as in the vicinity of homes with Deaf families.
attributes.additional_details:
Approximately 1 in every 1000 children is born with a severe or profound hearing loss. There are 11 million people with hearing loss across the UK, around one in six of the population. Deafness is the third most common disability in the world but you probably wouldn't spot a Deaf person in a crowd or know that a pedestrian has hearing loss.
The DSA handbook has warning signs for many things, deer crossing elderly people, schools and so on. A Deaf road warning sign is a glaring omission.

attributes.action: Increase the budget for Sussex Police to effectively protect the public
attributes.background: Over the past twenty years, operational police presence in Sussex has been reduced to dangerous levels. A lack of warranted officers is resulting in too many documented cases where there has been a lack of e police response leading to an increased the risk to public safety.
attributes.additional_details: As a former Sussex Police officer who was deployed as a urban and rural unformed officer and Detective, I am deeply concerned that Sussex Police is becoming more isolated and detached from the public it serves. Online referrals are no effective substitute for face to face engagement and the Government and local authority should recognise and react to the severe budgetary restraints that are causing the loss of public confidence in the counties police service.

attributes.action: Pay nursing students whilst on placement in University
attributes.background: Nursing students whilst in University work full time with the NHS. For some people, the money that they get from the NHS and their loan isn’t even enough to cover their rent and living costs.
attributes.additional_details: A lot of student nurses get depressed, anxiety and are over tired because they put so much hard work into their nursing degrees especially from all the placements including night shifts. A lot more get stressed because they physically can’t afford to live due to overpriced student housing and then money to live off for the whole year. There is also transport to think about for nurses going to placement. Student nurses feel like they’re ‘cheap labour’ for the NHS which is awful and upsetting.

attributes.action: the UK calls on the Turkish government to cease its military attacks on Afrin.
attributes.background:
I'm writing to you with regard to the worrying developments in Afrin, in northern Syria following the intervention of the Turkish military. 
A distressing situation has resulted from the heavy, indiscriminate bombing by the Turkish jets and artillery in heavily populated civilian areas in Afrin.
attributes.additional_details:
For years Afrin had been the safe haven for thousands of refugees who fled from neighboring cities and towns during the tragic civil war in Syria.
Remembering the tragedy of Kobane, no one would want to happen again in Afrin. 
I urge you to take up this matter with fellow members of the UK Parliament, who should demand that the UK government calls on the Turkish government to cease its military attacks on Afrin. 
Thank you in anticipation of your urgent attention to this matter.

Yours sincerely

attributes.action: Increase paternity leave so it is 3 months off on full pay.
attributes.background:
I would like to propose a change to the law regarding paternity leave. I think that the current law is determinal to parents and should be altered to support working families.
I feel that fathers should get 3 months paternity leave at full pay, with an option of a further 3 months at part pay.
attributes.additional_details:
The changes would also include kit days.
Extended leave would benefit:
1. Mums recovery. The minimum recovery time for a c section is 6 weeks. If dads were off for the 3 month period they would be able to support. 
2. Sleep deprevation - babies sleep is irregular in the first 3 months. There is lots of research on sleep deprevation and its negative impact in the workplace. 
3. Dad bonding - research suggests children with good paternal bonds are often better off later in life.

attributes.action: Prostate cancer screening tests for men ages 18+
attributes.background:
Men tend to be less likely to check themselves than women.

A screening is less scary and embarrassing for men than visiting their GP.

Women have the tools and aid put in place to help them however men don't... why is that ?
attributes.additional_details:
Prostate cancer is the most common cancer in men.

Every 45 minutes one man dies from prostate cancer – that's more than 11,000 men every year

In the UK, about 1 in 8 men will get prostate cancer at some point in their lives.

attributes.action: Provide more government funding to help our struggling hospices to survive.
attributes.background: Sue Ryder Foundation have said they are closing their hospice at Nettlebed. The local community are about to lose a much loved facility which in a unique way has provided help and support to cancer victims and their families for many years.

attributes.action: Make Mobility allowance available from birth on need, remove age discrimination.
attributes.background: Mobility allowance is only available to people over the age of 3, over  two thousand children under the age of 3 are required to have bulky medical equipment or specialised support wheelchairs, and as such are at risk when travelling in unsuitable or potentially unsafe vehicles  for their needs.
attributes.additional_details: The government wants children under three to go to a charity to get funding for a Wheelchair Accessible Vehicle, this is discriminating against them on the grounds of age, and goes against the governments own policy published on 1 October 2012 that outlaws discrimination based on age, the requirement for a Wheelchair Accessible Vehicle should be base wholly on the need of the child and age should not be a qualifying factor, these children can effectively become housebound because of this policy.

attributes.action: Give the electorate a Referendum to make House of Lords wholly elected via PR
attributes.background: The House of Lords membership criteria belongs to previous centuries, the UK  electorate deserves a wholly elected 2nd Chamber. Elected using solely proportional representation as a method of checks & balances.

attributes.action: Parliament to debate withdrawal of British support for Iran Nuclear deal.
attributes.background: On May 1st, BBC reported US response to Israel's claim of secret Iranian nuclear weapons factory hidden in Northern Syria, with the goal of producing 5 nuclear warheads. Israel presented evidence to show that Iran lied and defrauded the deal. http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-43958205
attributes.additional_details: The Iran deal has produced great international controversy since its signature in 2015. To many, the very idea of bribing a terrorist-supporting state not to produce nuclear weapons has always been a dangerous nonsense. The British government talked a big talk against Russia with the Skripal poisoning, but seems completely blind to Iran's recklessly dangerous actions. This double standard needs be justified with full public parliamentary debate about withdrawing from the Iran deal.

attributes.action: The UK government should allow Steve Bannon to enter the UK
attributes.background: Steve Bannon is not a far-right political figure he is just plain and simple Right.  To say he poses a risk to the security of the UK is absurd. He should be allowed to enter the UK and give a strong alternative view to the liberal left we have here.

attributes.action: PM to honour promise: BREXIT negotiated by Sen. Sec. of State who voted leave
attributes.background: The Prime Minister, by announcing that she will lead negotiations with the EU, while DExEU will only prepare, has broken her promise and lost the trust of the voting public and a significant part of her party and MPs.
attributes.additional_details: In June 2016, Theresa May promised that, "Brexit means Brexit". In the same speech, she promised, "I will therefore create a new government department responsible for conducting Britain’s negotiation with the EU and for supporting the rest of Whitehall in its European work. That department will be lead by a senior secretary of state and I will make sure that the position is taken by a Member of Parliament who campaigned for Britain to leave the EU."

attributes.action: Guarantee the right to remain in the UK of all Afghan interpreters
attributes.background: Afghan interpreters who served with the UK Armed Forces on Op HERRICK are currently at risk of deportation from the UK. If sent to Afghanistan they will likely be killed by the Taliban. We ask the Govt to grant Afghan interpreters and their families citizenship and the right to remain in the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.thetimes.co.uk/edition/news/afghan-interpreters-fear-being-sent-home-to-their-fate-under-visa-rules-0d7qdn8vr
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-manchester-43904806
https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/6198982/afghan-interpreters-uk-eviction-home-office-2400/

attributes.action: Expand driving penalties to include the charge vehicular manslaughter
attributes.background: I think that the increase in dangerous, reckless and careless driving needs to be properly addressed. In the wrong hands a car is as lethal as a loaded gun. Death should be charged as vehicular manslaughter and life changing injuries as attempted vehicular manslaughter.
attributes.additional_details: Although courts now have to power to sentence those who cause death by dangerous driving to 14 years to life, this penalty is rarely, if ever used. I feel that if the charge included the term manslaughter, not only would the perception of motorists change, but judges would be more inclined to sentence those who have caused death or life changing injuries, whilst driving at excessive speed, whilst using a mobile device, under the influence of drink/drugs to an appropriate custodial sentence.

attributes.action: A pre-biopsy MRI prostate assessment should be offered all men with elevated PSA
attributes.background: A pre-biopsy MRI assessment with contrast agent can detect prostate cancer not detected by the PSA test. All men with symptoms consistent with prostate cancer should be offered an MRI assessment within four weeks by their GP. This will aid early diagnosis improving patient outcome.
attributes.additional_details:
Practical Barriers to Obtaining Pre-Biopsy Prostate MRI: Assessment in over 1,500 Consecutive Men Undergoing Prostate Biopsy in a Single Urologic Practice 
A.B. Rosenkrantz 
ISSN: 0042-1138 , 1423-0399; DOI: 10.1159/000446003 
Urologia internationalis. , 2016, Vol.97(2), p.247-248

Prostate MRI Can Reduce Overdiagnosis and Overtreatment of Prostate Cancer 
A.B. Rosenkrantz 
ISSN: 1076-6332; DOI: 10.1016/j.acra.2015.02.006 
Academic Radiology , 2015, Vol.22(8), p.1000-1006

attributes.action: Make the use of single-use black plastic for food packaging illegal by 2020
attributes.background: Black plastic is widely used in food packaging and it cannot be recycled in most places.  There are viable alternatives readily available.

attributes.action: Urge Uganda to give MP Robert Ssetamu Kyagulanyi and his comrades a fair trial.
attributes.background: Ugandan MP Robert Ssetamu Kyagulanyi aka Bobi Wine and his comrades were arrested and allegedly brutally tortured whilst supporting campaigns for an aspiring opposition MP in the northern part of Uganda. We believe this incident is in breach of commonwealth democratic values.
attributes.additional_details: We fear that he has been arrested on false charges, simply for being a successful opposition politician and we are worried he will not be given a fair trial. The UK Government should do all it can to help ensure that Robert Ssetamu Kyagulanyi and his comrades are given a fair trial.

attributes.action: Introduce a license for dogs and cats to combat the stray animal/ shelter crisis
attributes.background: Further action must be brought in for owners, in order to prevent flippant animal purchases and irresponsible, unlicensed breeding. Sadly, charities are overflowing with pets; not enough responsibility is being taken by the owner- microchips just aren't enough, especially when details are outdated.
attributes.additional_details: According to the RSPCA Facts and Figures, investigators deal with over 149,000 calls annually in regards to cruelty and neglect as well as rescuing 129,602 animals but only re-homing 47,000. Sadly the Animal Welfare Act 2007 is not enough for ensuring responsible ownership due to the rise in popularity for designer dogs like pugs and huskies. Battersea Dogs and Cats Home are seeing more dogs and cats due to being an unwanted present or unable to pay for health issues.

attributes.action: Make the DVLA Vehicle Records and HPI records available to the public for FREE
attributes.background:
Fight for the freedom of information and the abuse by the current system forcing people to pay £20 to check a car for its records! 
All information should be free to the public including the details of the registered keepers. In many scenarios this free information could avoid a lot of difficulties
attributes.additional_details: It is unbelievable that the publics rights to freedom of information is In 2018 still being violated by the DVLA and car keeper details are still withheld from the public and kept secret only to be sold to third party companies [clamping and parking firms] (for £2.50 each check) it is absurd that these details should be held private and it shouldnt be any different than The Land Register that is available to the public. I don’t think I need to explain why all the HPI records should be free.

attributes.action: Stop NHS patients being weighed in public waiting rooms and corridors.
attributes.background: In NHS hospital departments, patients are weighed in a public waiting rooms within sight and earshot of other patients and visitors. The NHS must provide dignity for patients.
attributes.additional_details: This is humiliating for patients, especially those who may have experienced weight difficulties, insecurities around body image, mental health issues etc.

attributes.action: Reconsider the changes made to A-levels in respect to the amount of content.
attributes.background: New A-level changes have too much information content that needs to be taught, This is contributing to a student mental health crisis and is not allowing teacher to focus on development of expression, analysis and evaluation, essential skills required for student's future endeavours.

attributes.action: Condemn Israeli Army killings of 30 unarmed Palestinian protestors in Gaza
attributes.background: On Friday 30th March this year Palestinians living in the Gaza Strip gathered at various points along the border with Israel to peacefully protest the blockade and demand their right of return to homes that they had been driven out of in 1948 during the Nakba. Now 30 are dead and 1000+ injured.
attributes.additional_details: The 1948 Palestinian exodus, also known as the Nakba, literally "disaster", "catastrophe", or "cataclysm"), occurred when more than 700,000 Palestinian Arabs fled or were expelled from their homes, during the 1948 Palestine war. Between 400 and 600 Palestinian villages were sacked during the war, while urban Palestine was almost entirely extinguished. The term "nakba" also refers to the period of war itself and events affecting Palestinians from December 1947 to January 1949

attributes.action: Ban all new fossil fuel vehicles by 2030
attributes.background: The UK Government has committed to banning new diesel and petrol cars by 2040. This is too late. The Clean Growth Strategy and legally binding carbon budgets require policies & action on major emitters and transport is now the largest contributing sector to UK emissions and causes air pollution.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2018/mar/18/uk-should-bring-2040-petrol-and-diesel-car-ban-forward-2030-green-alliance

https://www.theccc.org.uk/2018/01/17/uks-ambitious-clean-growth-strategy-must-translated-urgently-action/

http://www.green-alliance.org.uk/resources/How_the_UK_can_lead_the_electric_vehicle_revolution.pdf

https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-40723581
